entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 22 at 3:01AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf Through Sunday afternoon... Elevated surf will continue through Sunday and cause minor beach erosion. West winds gusting to 40 mph will decrease to 25 mph by noon Sunday. Residents with items on the beach should move them inland to prevent them from washing away. The strongest winds, highest surf and greatest erosion will be
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 21 at 8:44PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The South Coast AQMD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect until noon on Monday. In areas directly impacted by high levels of windblown dust, limit
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coachella Valley; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 22 at 9:48AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to continue falling through Minor Flood Stage through this week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 22 at 9:09AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWEST GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY.. Relative humidity values of 25 percent or less are expected for at least four hours this afternoon over parts of northwest Georgia. While winds will be weaker than yesterday, north winds may gust to 15 to 20 mph.
